required_header.download_date: Information obtained from ClinicalTrials.gov on October 20, 2011
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stem Cell Transplant and Zoledronic Acid Improve Outcome in Previously Untreated Patients With Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Results of Phase III Study to Assess if Zoledronic Acid Have Antumor Activity in Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the impact in outcome of the use of zoledronic acid in multiple myeloma.

detailed_description.textblock: Assess if the use of zoledronic acid can improve outcome in patients with multiple myeloma whose are treated with cytoreductive therapy and stem cell transplant.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: progression-free disease and overall toxicity in myeloma multiple
primary_outcome.description: In patients treated with cytoreductive therapy following by stem cell transplant and that received zoledronic acid by 2 years,they were evaluable for assess antitumor effect of zoledronic acid

secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the number of skeletal events in patients with multiple myeloma that received zoledronic acid

arm_group.arm_group_label: zoledronic acid or not zoledronic acid
arm_group.description: patients with multiple myeloma will be treated with cytoreductive therapy following by zoledronic acid or not.

arm_group.arm_group_label: zoledronic acid or not zoledronic acid
arm_group.description: patients with multiple myeloma will be treated with cytoreductive therapy following by stem cell transplant and did not received zoledronic acid
Patients with multiple treated with cytoreductive therapy following by stem cell transplant will be planned to received zoledronic acid

intervention.description: zoledronic acid, 4 mg,standard dose,at monthly interval, by 2 years
intervention.arm_group_label: zoledronic acid or not zoledronic acid

study_pop.textblock: Patients with multiple myeloma previously untreated

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Diagnosis of multiple myeloma No previous treatment Symptomatic High risk (ISS) or stage III ( Durie-Salmon) No severe comorbidities -
Exclusion Criteria:
Pregnancy HIV + Refuse treatment
-
